title: Hirohito: the chrysanthemum throne
creator_contributor_role: New York Times Productions, production company
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Military occupation
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/World War, 1939-1945 - Japan
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Japan - Politics and government

Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/United States - Foreign relations - Japan
description: Examination of the Japanese emperor who, according to Shinto religion, is a direct descendant of the Sun God. Includes footage of Hirohito's visit to England in 1921 and in the 1960's; the signing of Japan's conditions of surrender at the end of the war; and the American occupation after the war. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary level.
